sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Even experienced programmers run into common issues when working with FTC robots. This lesson will help you quickly identify and fix the most frequent problems in OnBot Java.

sections.title: Hardware Mapping Errors
sections.content: One of the most common issues is a mismatch between your hardware configuration and your code. If you misspell a device name or forget to add a device in the configuration, your code will throw an error. Always double-check that your hardwareMap.get() calls match the names in your configuration.

sections.title: OpMode Lifecycle Mistakes
sections.content: Understanding when your code runs is crucial. Initialization code should go before waitForStart(), and your main loop should be inside while (opModeIsActive()). Placing code in the wrong place can cause unexpected behavior.

sections.title: Correct OpMode Structure
Sensor and Motor Initialization Problems
sections.content: If you try to use a sensor or motor before it's initialized, you'll get errors or unexpected results. Always initialize all hardware before waitForStart().

sections.title: Initialization Example
Quick Troubleshooting Checklist
content: Check that all device names in your code match your configuration.
Put your main robot logic inside while (opModeIsActive()).
Use telemetry to display variable values and program state.
Read error messages carefully and look up unfamiliar terms.

Explain what each error is and why it occurs.
Provide a corrected version of the OpMode.

answers.task: Identify all errors in the provided OpMode code.
answers.content:
There are 4 errors in this OpMode:

1. **Hardware Mapping Error (Line 12)**: "LEFT_DRIVE" should be "left_drive" (case-sensitive)
2. **Initialization Order Error (Line 18)**: Setting motor power before waitForStart()
3. **Unreachable Code Error (Lines 47-49)**: Code after the while loop will never execute
4. **Missing Error Handling**: No try-catch for potential hardware failures

answers.task: Explain what each error is and why it occurs.
answers.content:
**Error 1**: Hardware mapping is case-sensitive. "LEFT_DRIVE" doesn't match the configured "left_drive".

**Error 2**: Setting motor power before waitForStart() can cause unexpected behavior since the robot isn't ready yet.

**Error 3**: Code after the while loop is unreachable because the loop only exits when the OpMode stops.

**Error 4**: Missing error handling means hardware failures could crash the program.
